Subjective: Left ear pain and feeling of fullness ('water in ear') for 3-4 days. Pain worse after showering. Gradually worsening. Difficulty hearing in left ear. ICE (Concern): Worried about hearing loss and ear condition. Pain level: 4/10 daily, 6-7/10 after showering. Unable to swim due to pain. New swimmer (few weeks). Cleans ear with cotton buds ~3x/week. Negatives: No fever, no general illness. Social: Recently became Dutch citizen. Plan: Wants ear examined.
Objective: Vitals: Temp 36.2 C. Right Ear: Normal canal, eardrum clear. Left Ear: Canal swollen, red, inflamed, thickened. Eardrum not well visualized. Pain on pulling ear.
Assessment: Otitis externa (left ear). Ruled out: Otitis media, fever.
Plan: 1. Explanation: Left ear canal inflammation, likely due to water exposure and cotton bud use. 2. Pain relief: Paracetamol up to 4000mg/day if needed. 3. Ear drops: Anti-inflammatory, acidic drops 3x/day for 1 week. 4. Advice: Keep ear dry for 1 week, no more cotton bud cleaning. 5. Follow-up: Return in 1 week.
